author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Christie mysteries in Friday series
text:
Christie mysteries in Friday series Oct 03, 2015 Dame Margaret Rutherford Margaret Rutherford is a wry Miss Marple and Stringer Davis is Mr. Stringer in "Murder at the Gallop.” 
Thomaston — The Friends of the Thomaston Public Library’s Friday Night Film Series, hosted by Erika Pfander, offers free movie screenings weekly at 6:30 p.m. in Room 200 of the Thomaston Academy building at 60 Main St./Route 1; entrance, parking and handicapped accessibility is at the rear of the building. October’s theme is Murder a la Agatha Christie. 
The Oct. 9 film is “Murder At The Gallop” (1963, UK), a nonrated film that runs 81 minutes. When an antisocial villager unexpectedly drops dead, most assume he suffered a heart attack — everyone, that is, except Miss Marple (Margaret Rutherford). By scrutinizing each of the people who could have benefited from the victim's passing, she follows her instincts to reopen what seemed to be an open-and-shut case. Robert Morley and Flora Robson co-star in this adaptation of Agatha Christie’s “After the Funeral.” 
Upcoming in this month’s series are: Oct. 23, “Murder Most Foul” (1964, UK); and Oct. 30, “And Then There Were None” (1945, USA). Friday Night Films are open to the public free of charge, although donations are gratefully accepted. Light refreshments will be served. For more information, call the library at 354-2453. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
